conclusion: Analyze particle's motion in magnetic field to find magnetic induction B.

Setup with two uniform magnetic fields on either side of lines MN and PQ; particle injected at point c with velocity v0 at 45° to MN; collides with insulating plate ab and exits at point f, 2d from c.
Particle's initial velocity v0 has components v0x and v0y with v0x = v0y due to 45° angle.
Upon collision with the plate, horizontal component vx reverses direction while maintaining magnitude, vertical component vy remains unchanged.
Particle's motion in magnetic field follows a circular path with radius r = mvx/qB.
Particle exits magnetic field at point f, 2d from c; horizontal displacement 2d = vxt.
Using r = mvx/qB and 2d = vxt, find B.
Substitute vx = 2d/t into r = mvx/qB to solve for B.
Since t = 2d/vx, substitute to find B = mvx/q.
